channel.title: Apparmor rules update. What would you like to do about it?
channel.description:
When I update it ask
Setting up sdwdate (3:10.2-1) ...
Configuration file '/etc/apparmor.d/usr.bin.sdwdate' ==> Modified (by you or by a script) since installation. ==> Package distributor has shipped an updated version. What would you like to do about it ? Your options are: Y or I : install the package maintainer's version N or O : keep your currently-installed version D : show the differences between the versions Z : start a shell to examine the situation The default action is to keep your current version. *** usr.bin.sdwdate (Y/I/N/O/D/Z) [default=N] ?
Configuration file '/etc/apparmor.d/whonix-firewall' ==> Modified (by you or by a script) since installation. ==> Package distributor has shipped an updated version. What would you like to do about it ? Your options are: Y or I : install the package maintainer's version N or O : keep your currently-installed version D : show the differences between the versions Z : start a shell to examine the situation The default action is to keep your current version. *** whonix-firewall (Y/I/N/O/D/Z) [default=N] ?
I already press N because is default. What do I need to do next time I'm asked to choose a option ?

item.title: Apparmor rules update. What would you like to do about it?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
To reset the existing files to vendor default (recommended), see (just now created):
Reset Configuration Files to Vendor Default

Read full topic
item.source: Apparmor rules update. What would you like to do about it?

item.title: Apparmor rules update. What would you like to do about it?

item.description:
For next time…

Documented here, updated just now:

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Operating_System_Software_and_Updates#Changed_Configuration_Files

item.title: Apparmor rules update. What would you like to do about it?
item.dc:creator: Nexiko
item.description:
When I update it ask

Setting up sdwdate (3:10.2-1) ...

Configuration file '/etc/apparmor.d/usr.bin.sdwdate'
 ==> Modified (by you or by a script) since installation.
 ==> Package distributor has shipped an updated version.
   What would you like to do about it ?  Your options are:
    Y or I  : install the package maintainer's version
    N or O  : keep your currently-installed version
      D     : show the differences between the versions
      Z     : start a shell to examine the situation
 The default action is to keep your current version.
*** usr.bin.sdwdate (Y/I/N/O/D/Z) [default=N] ? 

Configuration file '/etc/apparmor.d/whonix-firewall'
 ==> Modified (by you or by a script) since installation.
 ==> Package distributor has shipped an updated version.
   What would you like to do about it ?  Your options are:
    Y or I  : install the package maintainer's version
    N or O  : keep your currently-installed version
      D     : show the differences between the versions
      Z     : start a shell to examine the situation
 The default action is to keep your current version.
*** whonix-firewall (Y/I/N/O/D/Z) [default=N] ?

I already press N because is default. What do I need to do next time I’m asked to choose a option ?

Read full topic
item.source: Apparmor rules update. What would you like to do about it?
